itemDescription: Irish barrister, politician and judge; Attorney General and Chief Justice of the Irish Free State (1879-1936)

wikipedia_page.main: Hugh Edward Kennedy KC (11 July 1879 – 1 December 1936) was an Irish Cumann na nGaedheal politician, barrister and judge who served as Chief Justice of Ireland from 1924 to 1936, a Judge of the Supreme Court from 1924 to 1936 and Attorney General of Ireland from 1922 to 1924. He served as a Teachta Dála (TD) for the Dublin South constituency from 1923 to 1927. As a member of the Irish Free State Constitution Commission, he was also one of the constitutional architects of the Irish Free State.
